title: Online Communities as Networks
description: A 60-second lesson on Online Communities as Networks.

hook.text: A Slack community of 500 product managers. She contributes weekly. In a year, she knows the industry.

buildup.text: Online communities â€” Slack, Discord, forums â€” are the modern equivalent of professional associations.

discovery.text: Active contributors are visible. Lurkers are invisible. The value comes from giving, not just reading.

twist.text: The best opportunities in communities go to consistent contributors, not occasional visitors.

climax.text: Choose two to three communities aligned with your goals. Show up weekly. Help generously.

punchline.text: Communities are networks with a door fee: your contribution.
